properties.name: Actium (31 BC)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeOctavian defeats the fleet of Mark Antony and Cleopatra, and becomes the only ruler of Rome (31 BC)

properties.name: Adrianople (324)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeOn 3 July 324, Constantine defeated Licinius

properties.name: Adrianople (378)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeOn 9 August 378, Fritigern and his Goths defeated the Roman army and killed Emperor Valens, in one of the major defeats in all Roman history

properties.name: Adys (255 BC)
properties.description: Posted by Panairjddetunis, tunisiaIn early 255 BC, Atilius Regulus defeated the Carthaginians, led by Hasdrubal

properties.name: Aegates Islands (241 BC)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddefavignanaOn 10 March 241 BC, Lutatius Catulus defeated a Carthaginian fleet led by Hanno, ending the First Punic War

properties.description: Posted by Panairjddeagrigento, italyIn 261 BC, the Roman army defeated the Carthaginian garrison of Agrigentum led by Hannibal Gisco and the supporting army led by Hanno, and conquers the city

properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeOn 8 June 218, Emperor Macrinus is defeated and deposed by Elagabalus army

properties.name: Aquae Sextiae (102 BC)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeAix-en-ProvenceIn 102 BC, Marius defeats the Teutones

properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeMontmortIn 58 BC, Julius Caesar defeats the Helvetii

properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeIn late 316, Constantine I defeated Licinius

properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeOn 2 August 216 BC, Hannibal defeats Paullus and Varro, in one of his masterpieces

properties.name: Ctesiphon (363)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddebaghdadOn 29 May 363, Emperor Julian defeated a Sassanid army under the walls of Sassanid capital Ctesiphon. He is unable to take the city, however.

properties.description: Posted by Panairjddetrapani, italyIn 249 BC, a Carthaginian fleet defeated the Romans, led by Claudius Pulcher, attemting to block the port of Drepana

properties.description: Posted by PanairjddedurazzoOn 10 July 48 BC, Pompey defeats Julius Caesar

properties.name: Lake Benacus (268)
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeIn November 268, Claudius II defeated the Alamanni. His great victory against a larger army marks the start of the recovery from the Crisis of the Third Century.

properties.name: Tiburtina training facility
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeThe computer science training facility of La Sapienza University, Tiburtina see. In the afternoon, all the connection towards the Internet outside Italy interrupted. A notice reported a malfunction in the routers put under one of the Twin Towers, which connected us to the world. Then someone told us what had happened.
